intro: Crepidiastrum lanceolatum f. subpetiolatum, commonly known as the narrow-leaved star-of-Bethlehem, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped blue or violet flowers. The plant features narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are often borne on short petioles, giving it its subspecies name. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or wetland habitats. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for gardens and conservation efforts.
